oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white two-sided propaganda leaflet conveys on the front a split image of Viet-Cong blowing up a hut and on the back a happy non-combatant family in a safe village. The reverse contains text and the leaflet number (246-354).

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Chieu Hoi (Open Arms) program represents a 10-year psychological operation launched by the South Vietnamese government in April 1963. Defection was encouraged by using the five themes of Chieu Hoi: exploitation of ralliers, rally appeals, third party inducement, advertisement, and instructions on how to rally. Five billion leaflets were air-dropped over Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia in seven years.
